# BioShiftR (in development\*) ![](reference/figures/BioShiftR_logo.png)

### An R package to access, manipulate, and organize the BioShifts database.

[BioShifts](https://figshare.com/articles/dataset/BioShifts_a_global_geodatabase_of_climate-induced_species_redistribution_over_land_and_sea/7413365)
is a global database of over 31,000 changes in speciesâ€™ range positions
documented in scientific literature, spanning global geographies and
taxonomic groups. The database contains documentations of range changes
as listed in source publications, as well as standardized calculated
rates of change along latitudinal and elevational gradients, and various
supplemental data for hypothesis-testing.

BioShifts is a rich resource for studying the effects of climate change
on the biogeography of life on Earth, but accessing and manipulating the
large and complex database can be daunting.

`BioShiftR` offers a streamlined and simplified approach for accessing,
organizing, and manipulating BioShifts range shift data, with functions
for simple collation of raw data, stardized calculated values,
associated climate velocities, taxonomy, and more.

## Package Installation

``` r
install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("Bioshifts/BioShiftR")
```

## Usage

For detailed instructions and example workflows, see vignettes on the
[package website](https://bioshifts.github.io/BioShiftR/index.html)

## Contact

This package is currently unpublished and in-development. For questions
and comments, please reach me at <jake.lawlor@mail.mcgill.ca>

# Package index

## All functions

- [`add_articles()`](https://bioshifts.github.io/BioShiftR/reference/add_articles.md)
  : Add article identifiers to range shift data
- [`add_author_reported()`](https://bioshifts.github.io/BioShiftR/reference/add_author_reported.md)
  : Add author-reported shift results to range shifts
- [`add_baselines()`](https://bioshifts.github.io/BioShiftR/reference/add_baselines.md)
  : Add baseline temperatures of species- or study-area polygons for
  each range shift
- [`add_cv()`](https://bioshifts.github.io/BioShiftR/reference/add_cv.md)
  : Add Climate Velocity to shifts dataframe
- [`add_methods()`](https://bioshifts.github.io/BioShiftR/reference/add_methods.md)
  : Add methods to range shift documentations
- [`add_poly_info()`](https://bioshifts.github.io/BioShiftR/reference/add_poly_info.md)
  : Add polygon attributes to range shift dataframe
- [`add_polygons()`](https://bioshifts.github.io/BioShiftR/reference/add_polygons.md)
  : Add polygons to range shift database
- [`add_taxo()`](https://bioshifts.github.io/BioShiftR/reference/add_taxo.md)
  : Add taxonomy to range shifts
- [`add_trends()`](https://bioshifts.github.io/BioShiftR/reference/add_trends.md)
  : Add climate variable trends to range shift dataframe
- [`download_polygons()`](https://bioshifts.github.io/BioShiftR/reference/download_polygons.md)
  : Download spatial data from OSF
- [`get_shifts()`](https://bioshifts.github.io/BioShiftR/reference/get_shifts.md)
  : Get BioShifts Range Shifts - Start Here.
